Deprecated API

Contents

  • Methods
  • Constructors
  • Deprecated Methods
    Method
    Description
    org.apache.click.extras.cayenne.CayenneTemplate.createAndRegisterNewObject(Class<T>)
    since 2.3.0, use CayenneTemplate.newObject(java.lang.Class) instead.
    org.apache.click.extras.control.AbstractContainerField.getContainer()
    the internal container instance was removed, AbstractContainerField can be used without accessing the internal container
    org.apache.click.extras.control.AbstractContainerField.replace(Control, Control)
    this method was used for stateful pages, which have been deprecated
    org.apache.click.extras.control.CheckList.addStyle(String)
    use @{link #setStyle(String, String)}
    org.apache.click.extras.control.CheckList.getHtmlClass()
    use AbstractControl.getAttribute(String) instead
    org.apache.click.extras.control.CheckList.getValues()
    use CheckList.getSelectedValues() instead
    org.apache.click.extras.control.CheckList.setHtmlClass(String)
    use AbstractControl.addStyleClass(String) instead
    org.apache.click.extras.control.CheckList.setValues(List<String>)
    use CheckList.setSelectedValues(List) instead
    org.apache.click.extras.control.Menu.getRootMenu()
    use MenuFactory.getRootMenu() instead
    org.apache.click.extras.control.Menu.getRootMenu(AccessController)
    use MenuFactory.getRootMenu(org.apache.click.extras.security.AccessController) instead
    org.apache.click.extras.control.Menu.loadRootMenu(AccessController)
    use MenuFactory.loadFromMenuXml(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, org.apache.click.extras.security.AccessController, java.lang.Class) instead
  • Deprecated Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    org.apache.click.extras.control.Menu(Element, AccessController)
    use MenuFactory.buildMenu(org.w3c.dom.Element, org.apache.click.extras.security.AccessController, java.lang.Class) instead
    org.apache.click.extras.tree.TreeNode(Object, String, TreeNode)
    use TreeNode(java.lang.Object, java.lang.String) instead and add to parent node through TreeNode.add(org.apache.click.extras.tree.TreeNode). Creates a node and sets the value, id and parent to the specified arguments.
    org.apache.click.extras.tree.TreeNode(Object, String, TreeNode, boolean)
    use TreeNode(java.lang.Object, java.lang.String, boolean) instead and add to parent node through TreeNode.add(org.apache.click.extras.tree.TreeNode). Creates a node and sets the value, id and parent to the specified arguments.
